
# RSA Signature

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dc1258e3-0d76-4113-96c7-1ed9c1f7623e)

The private keys are

```
N = 
d = 
```

so I made a python code.. (i figured out myself thats why its not really optimized xD)

```python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes,bytes_to_long
import hashlib

N = 
d = 


flag = b'crypto{Immut4ble_m3ssag1ng}'
hashed = hashlib.new('sha256')
hashed.update(flag)

h = hashed.hexdigest()
m = int(h, 16)
s = pow(m, d, N)

print(s)

```




# Monoprime

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2bd52f3c-04e0-494f-9202-d2a9801b28d0)

output.txt
```
n =                                                                   
e = 65537
ct =   
```
after factoring in [factordb](factordb.com), I found out that the prime factor is ```n = p*1``` which means ```n = p``` and ```q = 1```
so we can easily compute the d and decrypt the cipher text


```python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, inverse

n = 
e = 65537
ct = 

d = inverse(e, n-1)
m = pow(ct, d, n)
print(long_to_bytes(m))
```
\n \n
# Manyprime

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/523d6326-c8de-45d0-b39a-4edb94282004)

output.txt
```
n = 
e = 65537
ct = 
```

factoring ```n``` in [factordb](factordb.com) gives us 30 factors. put them into a list and calculate ```phi``` with for loop.

```python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes

n = 
e = 65537
ct = 

factors = [9282105380008121879, 9303850685953812323, 9389357739583927789, 10336650220878499841, 10638241655447339831, 11282698189561966721, 11328768673634243077, 11403460639036243901, 11473665579512371723, 11492065299277279799, 11530534813954192171, 11665347949879312361, 12132158321859677597, 12834461276877415051, 12955403765595949597, 12973972336777979701, 13099895578757581201, 13572286589428162097, 14100640260554622013, 14178869592193599187, 14278240802299816541, 14523070016044624039, 14963354250199553339, 15364597561881860737, 15669758663523555763, 15824122791679574573, 15998365463074268941, 16656402470578844539, 16898740504023346457, 17138336856793050757, 17174065872156629921, 17281246625998849649]

phi = 1
for factor in factors:
    phi *= (factor-1)

d = pow(e, -1, phi)
m = pow(ct, d, n)

print(long_to_bytes(m))
```

output: ```b'crypto{700_m4ny_5m4ll_f4c70r5}'```


the output is:
```b'crypto{0n3_pr1m3_41n7_pr1m3_l0l}'```
